JobTitle: Senior Researcher – Deep Learning for Chemistry
JobFullDesc: As a Senior Researcher you will solve challenging real-world problems at the intersection of Chemistry and Deep Learning. You will collaborate with a team made up of both machine learning and chemistry experts to drive and implement an ambitious research agenda on multiple problem domains within Computer-Aided Molecular Discovery. There is no closing deadline for this post. The post will be filled once a suitable candidate is found so if you are interested please apply as soon as possible. When submitting your application, include your CV with a list of your top 5 publications as an attachment. For more information about the post, please feel free to email marwinsegler@microsoft.com.ResponsibilitiesContribute to, drive and implement machine learning research for key challenges in computer-aided drug discovery which go beyond the maximisation of simple metrics.Develop research infrastructure for rapid machine learning experimentation.Collaborate and work in an interdisciplinary team with internal and external partners towards ambitious research milestonesCommunicate research findings internally and externally, e.g. via conference or journal publicationsExhibit a growth mindset, and contribute to an inclusive team culture, where everyone is empowered to do their best work and work together on project success regardless of job titles.QualificationsPhD in machine learning, computational chemistry/physics, chemoinformatics, bioinformatics or a related area, or equivalent practical experience.Understanding of deep learning approaches for molecular applications.Experience with chemoinformatics, computational chemistry, molecular dynamics and/or quantum chemistry methods.Programming experience, evidenced by the implemented of machine learning techniques in computational chemistry.Demonstrated track record of high-quality publications at ML conferences and/or chemistry journals.Effective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
